page.title: 02TOW LAW'S HISTORY.
page.content: { {In 1845 the Weardale Iron Co. started {an iron-works, and four collieries {were sunk nearby within 6 years. By {1860 the population had risen from {under 200 to over 3,000 and 2 more {collieries had begun work.}The railway linked Tow Law with many local towns and though the iron-works and some pits had closed down by 1890, the population was then nearly 4,400. {By 1930 all the remaining pits had {closed; Tow Law's heyday was over! A small steel foundry was opened in 1941 but within 14 years the railway had also closed leaving Tow Law with it's only remaining asset; the cattle mart which had opened in 1882. New homes were built to replace the old pit-cottages but because of the lack of jobs people continued to leave. The present population is about 2,200.
